Backtesting and Forecasting¶

This section contains backtesting methods, ready to be used to test the performances of your models.

Methods Summary

u8timeseries.backtesting.backtesting_udf.backtest_autoregressive_model(…)

Provides a back-testing environment.

u8timeseries.backtesting.forecasting_simulation.simulate_forecast_ar(…)

Provides an environment for forecasting future values of the TimeSeries ‘series`.

Methods Documentation

u8timeseries.backtesting.backtest_autoregressive_model(model: u8timeseries.models.autoregressive_model.AutoRegressiveModel, train_val_series: List[Tuple[TimeSeries, TimeSeries]], eval_fn: Callable[[TimeSeries, TimeSeries], Any]) → List[Any][source]¶

Provides a back-testing environment.

Going through the list ‘train_val_series`, this function successively trains a chosen auto-regressive model model on the training TimeSeries provided, compares the prediction with the validation TimeSeries provided using eval_fn.

The results are stored in a list, returned to the user.

Parameters

  • train_val_series – A list of tuples (train, val) to be passed to the model model.

  • model – The chosen model to use.

  • eval_fn – The evaluation criteria.

Returns

A list of results obtain via the process described above.

u8timeseries.backtesting.simulate_forecast_ar(series: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, model: u8timeseries.models.autoregressive_model.AutoRegressiveModel, start: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp, fcast_horizon_n: int, trim_to_series: bool = True, verbose=False) → u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries[source]¶

Provides an environment for forecasting future values of the TimeSeries ‘series`.

This function predicts the fcast_horizon_n values for the TimeSeries series starting from the date start according to the auto-regressive model model.

Parameters

  • series – The TimeSeries to forecast.

  • model – The AutoRegressiveModel to use.

  • start – The first time at which a prediction is produced for a future time.

  • fcast_horizon_n – The number of future values to predict.

  • trim_to_series – Whether the predicted series has the end trimmed to match the end of the main series or not.

  • verbose – Whether to print progress or not.

Returns

A TimeSeries containing the fore-casted values of series over the horizon with respect to the model model.
